review: I have owned an Apple TV (3rd Generation), my parents own a Roku. I purchased the Chromecast because I was curious and it ended up replacing my Apple TV. Any device can be a remote, the future possibilities for in-app casting are endless, the picture quality is fantastic (especially using the Hulu Plus app for Android), it does NOT overheat (or even get very hot) if you use the extension cable to angle it away from your TV. There were no wireless traffic problems to my surprise. I don't see my network slowing down or our internet, which is fairly slow at 12mbps. If you have slow internet, you can cast in 480p SD. This thing is feature packed and really pretty incredible for only $35!
author: mike

review: I researched the chromecast device to ensure it worked with an iPad.  My wife has collected hundreds of pictures on her iPad and wished to display them on the TV.  The chromecast does work with the iPad but only with Chrome (which I knew) but I have yet to find a way for Chrome on the iPad to display pictures stored on that iPad.  Other than that the Chromecast works great, streams movies, and will display picutures sent from my MBP.
